title: Can No. 1 Sabalenka be defeated? Amanda Anisimova may find a way
description: The Wimbledon semifinal between top-ranked Sabalenka and American Anisimova might not be as straightforward as it seems. We break it down.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: The 'unbelievable' comeback story of Belinda Bencic at Wimbledon
description: Unseeded Belinda Bencic has had an improbable tournament at Wimbledon -- just a year after giving birth.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: What is the Wimbledon tennis schedule?
description: Marcel Granollers and Horacio Zeballos will continue their pursuit of completing the Roland Garros-Wimbledon double on Thursday, when they meet home hopes Julian Cash and Lloyd Glasspool in the semi-finals. View the day's featured matches below and the full order of play here. Centre Court (starts 1:30 p.m.)  [1] Aryna Sabalenka vs. [13] Amanda Anisimova (USA) Belinda Bencic (SUI) vs. [8] Iga Swiatek (POL) Sem Verbeek/Katerina Siniakova vs. Joe Salisbury/Luisa Stefani No. 1 Court (starts 1 p.m.) [1] Marcelo Arevalo/Mate Pavic vs. Rinky Hijikata/David Pel [4] Marcel Granollers/Horacio Zeballos vs. [5] Julian Cash/Lloyd Glasspool Alfie Hewett/Gordon Reid vs. Daniel Caverzaschi/Tokito Oda Read More from Wimbledon: Djokovic on 'nasty fall': 'The real impact I will feel tomorrow' Sinner: I was always going to play, just unsure at what level… Shelton on Sinner: 'Never seen anything like it' [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What were the Wimbledon results?
description: Top seed Jannik Sinner and seven-time Wimbledon champion Novak Djokovic both advanced on Wednesday, setting a blockbuster semi-final clash at the grass-court major. View Wednesday's featured results from the All England Club below and click here to see all scores. Centre Court Belinda Bencic (SUI) def. [7] Mirra Andreeva 7-6(3), 7-6(2) [6] Novak Djokovic (SRB) def. [22] Flavio Cobolli (ITA) 6-7(8), 6-2, 7-5, 6-4 No. 1 Court [8] Iga Swiatek (POL) def. [19] Liudmila Samsonova 6-2, 7-5 [1] Jannik Sinner (ITA) def. [10] Ben Shelton (USA) 7-6(2), 6-4, 6-4 Read More from Wimbledon: Djokovic on 'nasty fall': 'The real impact I will feel tomorrow' Sinner: I was always going to play, just unsure at what level… Shelton on Sinner: 'Never seen anything like it'[NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Djokovic to face Sinner in tantalising semi-final
description: Novak Djokovic sets up a mouth-watering semi-final against Italian top seed Jannik Sinner after coming through a tricky encounter against Flavio Cobolli.

title: Bencic hatching plan 'while falling asleep' to beat Swiatek in semi-finals
description: Wimbledon semi-finalist Belinda Bencic thinks up game plans while she's drifting off to sleep - with her latest being to visualise beating Iga Swiatek.

title: Wimbledon 2025 Day Ten Recap
description: The top half of the Wimbledon men’s draw held firm on Wednesday, as Jannik Sinner and Novak Djokovic both booked their places in the semi-final, though not without some questions. Sinner, who fluked his way into the last eight, showed no signs of discomfort as he dispatched Ben Shelton in straight sets, extending his head-to-head …
author: Jonathan

title: Wimbledon 2025 Day Nine Recap
description: Day Nine at Wimbledon unfolded without much drama, but with plenty of quality, as Taylor Fritz and Carlos Alcaraz both moved into the semi-finals in straightforward fashion. Fritz saw off Karen Khachanov in four sets, producing two dominant opening sets, navigating a mid-match lapse, and finishing the job in a composed tiebreak to reach his …
author: Jonathan
